title: The Bachelorette: Angie Kent opens up about endometriosis battle three years after surgery
text:
Angie Kent has opened up about dreams to become a mother despite suffering with endometriosis.

The Bachelorette said she has dreamed of having children ever since she was young.

Speaking to Sydney Confidential, the 29-year-old said: 'Whether it is adopting or fostering, I will have babies however I can.'

Feeling broody Angie? Angie Kent (pictured) has opened up about dreams to become a mother despite suffering with endometriosis

Former Gogglebox star Angie said she doesn't yet know if suffering with endometriosis will affect her fertility in the future.

'That is something you find out when you try and I haven’t tried. But having endometriosis, it does make it that bit harder,' she said.

'And if I am unable to carry a child, I will still be a mother no matter what as I have always wanted to be one since I was a little girl.'

Angie underwent keyhole surgery to treat the condition three years ago, but has yet to explore what it could mean for her future as a mum.

Heartbreaking: Angie underwent keyhole surgery to treat the condition three years ago, but has yet to explore what it could mean for her future as a mum

What is endometriosis? How the disorder results in pelvic pain and internal scarring Endometriosis is an often painful disorder in which tissue similar to the lining of the uterus - the endometrium - grows outside the uterus. It most commonly affects the ovaries, Fallopian tubes and the tissue lining the pelvis. The primary symptom of endometriosis is pelvic pain although many women also experience cramping during their menstrual cycle. Symptoms also include painful periods, pain with intercourse, pain with bowel movements or urination, inflammation, excessive bleeding and infertility. Often misdiagnosed, many women only discover they have the condition during infertility treatment. Approximately half of women diagnosed with endometriosis have difficulty getting pregnant. While studies about the link between endometriosis and miscarriages are still ongoing, newer research suggests that the condition can leave sufferers at greater risk of having a miscarriage. Source: Mayo Clinic

However, she said that when the time is right, she will do everything she can to prepare her body and aid her chances of falling pregnant.

During Angie's season of the show, which continues this week, the bubbly blonde has been vocal about her desire to have children.

In Wednesday's episode, she opened up about her future, and said while she doesn't fixate on timelines, she would like to have children in the next five years.

Final nine: During Angie's season of The Bachelorette, which continues this week, the bubbly blonde has been vocal about her desire to have children.

As she searches for her Mr Right in the series, Angie is determined to make sure they're on the same page when it comes to having children.

But weeding out contestants who were not on the show to find a genuine connection has been harder than expected.

She was left in tears in Wednesday's episode when firefighter Jamie Doran, 39, pulled her aside with claims front-runner Carlin Sterritt was only on the show to boost his media profile.

Angie also sent one suitor home after he was honest about having little desire to have children of his own in the future.
